items.title: Hyderabad knows its flood map but still drowns
items.summary: Twenty-five years after the big flood of 2000, Hyderabad continues to live on the edge of disaster. The city has long known its flood map, its gradient and its vulnerabilities. Yet, little has changed on ground. Reports gather dust, lakes vanish under concrete and warnings remain unheeded even as th

items.title: U.S. low-value package tariff exemption ends, raising costs for shippers, consumers
items.summary: The de minimis exemption has been in place since 1938, starting at $5 for gift imports and was raised from $200 to $800 in 2015 as a means to foster small business growth on e-commerce marketplaces

items.title:
How the number of electors went up
and down over the years in the State
items.summary:
The deletion of 65 lakh electors from Bihar’s draft electoral rolls has kicked up a row nationwide. In Tamil Nadu, the decline in the size of the electorate lasted between 1999 and 2009. In fact, in 2009, when the State faced the Lok Sabha election, close to 50 
lakh names were dropped from the roll

items.title: Where Shaivism and crafts blend
items.summary:
Thiruvathigai, where Saint Thirunavukkarasar, once a Jain, was cured of a stomach ailment and embraced Shaivism, is
also renowned for skilled artisans who craft temple vahanas and cars. They carry on the tradition for generations

items.title:
When two departments of Tamil Nadu government turn ‘in-laws’ at 
Vriddachalam temple festival
items.summary: A custom that is believed to have originated during the British period more than a century ago is still being followed at the temple of Lord Viruthagireeswarar and Goddess Viruthambigai.
